page.title: 18St Mary's Church Cheshunt
page.content: St Mary's Church of the Virgin was built in 1418. The font dates from 1318 and is evidence of an earlier wooden church. The earliest graves are from Henry 8th. The latest graves are from 1850. The parish records date from 1559. There is mention of a priest at Cheshunt in the Domesday survey 1086. There is a royal coat of arms of Charles the second. The church has 47 different masons marks. There are 33,000 people in the parish and 2 extra churches, St. Clements and Little St. Marys. The vicar's work includes writing sermons and news sheets and visiting hospitals and schools. His favourite work is helping people in trouble. There are about 100 weddings each year. 160 people attend the church each Sunday.
